verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Now you will see what I am going to do to Pharaoh. Because of my powerful hand, he will let them go. In fact, because of my powerful hand, he will force them out of his country."

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Moses, and said unto him, I am the LORD:
verses.ct: God spoke to Moses and said, "I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name JEHOVAH was I not known to them.
verses.ct: I revealed myself to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as God Almighty, but I did not make myself known to them by my name, the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers.
verses.ct: I also established my covenant with them, promising to give them the land of Canaan, where they lived as foreigners.

verses.kjv: And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage; and I have remembered my covenant.
verses.ct: I have also heard the cries of the Israelites, whom the Egyptians are holding in slavery, and I have remembered my covenant.

verses.kjv: Wherefore say unto the children of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm, and with great judgments:
verses.ct: Therefore, tell the Israelites: I am the LORD. I will free you from the heavy labor the Egyptians have put on you. I will rescue you from slavery to them. I will save you with my outstretched arm and with mighty acts of judgment.

verses.kjv: And I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, which bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: I will claim you as my own people, and I will be your God. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God, the one who frees you from the heavy labor of the Egyptians.

verses.kjv: And I will bring you in unto the land, concerning the which I did swear to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it you for an heritage: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I will bring you into the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. I will give it to you as your permanent possession. I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake so unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
verses.ct: Moses told all of this to the Israelites, but they would not listen to him because their spirits were crushed by the brutality of their slavery.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.ct: "Go and tell Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, to release the Israelites from his country."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake before the LORD, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
verses.ct: But Moses protested to the LORD, "Look, the Israelites wouldn't even listen to me. Why would Pharaoh listen to me? I'm a terrible speaker!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to both Moses and Aaron and gave them instructions regarding the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, commanding them to lead the Israelites out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: These be the heads of their fathers’ houses: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel; Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these be the families of Reuben.
verses.ct: Here are the leaders of their ancestral families: The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi. These were the clans of Reuben.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.
verses.ct: The sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, who was the son of a Canaanite woman. These were the clans of Simeon.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations; Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari: and the years of the life of Levi were an hundred thirty and seven years.
verses.ct: Here are the names of Levi's sons, listed by their family lines: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. Levi lived to be 137 years old.

verses.kjv: The sons of Gershon; Libni, and Shimi, according to their families.
verses.ct: The sons of Gershon, by their clans, were Libni and Shimi.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Kohath; Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel: and the years of the life of Kohath were an hundred thirty and three years.
verses.ct: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. Kohath lived to be 133 years old.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Merari; Mahali and Mushi: these are the families of Levi according to their generations.
verses.ct: The sons of Merari were Mahali and Mushi. These were the clans of Levi, listed by their family lines.

verses.kjv: And Amram took him Jochebed his father’s sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram were an hundred and thirty and seven years.
verses.ct: Amram married his father's sister Jochebed, and she gave birth to Aaron and Moses. Amram lived to be 137 years old.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.ct: The sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Uzziel; Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.
verses.ct: The sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan, and Zithri.

verses.kjv: And Aaron took him Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, to wife; and she bare him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.ct: Aaron married Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab and sister of Naashon. She gave birth to Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Korah; Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korhites.
verses.ct: The sons of Korah were Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These were the clans of the Korhites.

verses.kjv: And Eleazar Aaron’s son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bare him Phinehas: these are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
verses.ct: Aaron's son Eleazar married one of Putiel's daughters, and she gave birth to Phinehas. These were the leaders of the Levite families, listed by their clans.

verses.kjv: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.
verses.ct: This is the same Aaron and Moses to whom the LORD said, "Lead the Israelites out of Egypt, organized by their divisions."

verses.kjv: These are they which spake to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
verses.ct: These are the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt about bringing the Israelites out of Egypt — this same Moses and Aaron.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the day when the LORD spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.ct: On the day the LORD spoke to Moses in Egypt,

verses.kjv: That the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, I am the LORD: speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say unto thee.
verses.ct: the LORD said to him, "I am the LORD. Tell Pharaoh king of Egypt everything that I tell you."

verses.kjv: And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
verses.ct: But Moses replied to the LORD, "Look, I'm a terrible speaker. Why would Pharaoh ever listen to me?"
